Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: travellight4489
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms were different to what we are used to everything else made up for it. Excellent staff, great location. We were in Paris and lived the life! Wth children aged 11 and 15 it was safe, clean and gave us the character of living in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Basic and great location”
Reviews.Author: A F
Reviews.Content: This place was clean and in a great location. Staff is not incredibly friendly, but that seems to be the overall theme in Paris in general. Avoid the downstairs rooms facing the street--there is a bar right in front. Otherwise, it was a basic, clean hotel and we had a good stay. Tiny showers!

Reviews.Title: “More like a hostel!”
Reviews.Author: tinkerbell_edi
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very small. not well taken care of. there was not good wifi reception to all of the rooms and the night receptionist was not very willing to help or interact. the location seems a bit spooky if you are a girl travelling alone but it turns out to be quite safe.

Reviews.Title: “Small room but great location.”
Reviews.Author: Neha P
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and i really enjoyed it. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. I stayed in a room on the first floor. It was a very small room but this was what i was expecting when i accounted for other reviews and generally what i expected from Paris. The room was very clean. My room was located on the side of the little street that the hotel entrance is off and directly opposite the little cafe. In the evening there are a lot of people outside the cafe so you might find it a little noisy. The cafe plays live music and because i was so close i could hear it loud and clear. I actually really enjoyed this but some people may not. The hotel was located right near Grand Boulevards metro station but is walking distance to Notre Dame (about 20 minutes), Marais and the Louvre. There are lots of nice restaraunts and shops near it. I was travelling by myself and felt safe in the area. I did catch taxis back to the hotel late at night but generally it was fine. One thing i was disappointed in was that the breakfast was the same everyday. A croissant, baguette and cheese. This would be fine for the first couple of days but if you do plan on staying longer you might find that you want to explore other breakfast options.

Reviews.Title: “Emeraude Hotel D'Espagne”
Reviews.Author: pengachoosa
Reviews.Content: When we walked into the hotel we were greeted a very friendly desk staff he had us checked in and in our rooms very quickly. The clerks recommendation for a place to eat dinner was right on. The rooms were small but adequate private bathroom and nice big windows that opened to let in the fresh air. All in all for the price it was a great base camp to explore Paris. A note the Night clerk was a bit grumpy but other then that took care of our needs. Our stay was very enjoyable and I would come here again next time I visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Too small rooms for the price”
Reviews.Author: Axel007
Reviews.Content: All in all, a mixed experience: - positive: staff extremely friendly, location (central, close to Grands Boulevards and Grands Magasins) and cleanliness - negative: the rooms are EXTREMELY small (room and bathroom + view on an airshaft), and even if yes, this is the standard in Paris, I have been in hotels for less money with bigger rooms. Breakfast also totally ordinary. So I would recommend other hotels for Paris (see my other reviews).

Reviews.Title: “helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: fanmali
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for one night, Our room on the first floor was really small but clean,The beds were comfortable, The staff were friendly, We got a map of Paris as soon as we arrived at the front desk which is quite handy, She also circle the places we like to visit on the map for us. We enjoyed our stay because of the location and the lovely staff.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value for Paris, great location”
Reviews.Author: cagalindo
Reviews.Content: A bit hard to find. Go up the Musee Grevin exit from the metro station Grand Boulevard, turn around, make a left on that intersection. It is in the entrance on the right, arched pathway, with Cite Berger Hotels sign. We had the top room. It is a bit different than the others. Was okay. Need to get wifi code at the lobby. A bit of a hassle, the code expires daily, ask for a longer time period. Supermarket 1 minute walking across the arched pathway. Also, don't skip Musee Grevin!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: stosto
Reviews.Content: Me and my 3 friends stayed here for 3 nights and we had a pleasant stay at this hotel. The location was excellent! a 25 minutes walk to sacre cour, and its a very nice walk too. a very nice area full of cozy cafes. Area couldnt have been more perfect, when you walk out of the gates of the hotel you are immediately met by cafes/restaurants and a very lively area. Very close to the tube grand boulevards, 5 min walk. The hotel staff was adorable, really nice people. The rooms were big, and a big bed as well, and CLEAN! Also a very good thing about this hotel is that you have free wifi (only in the hotel lobby though) and you can also borrow a computer that is situated in the lobby if you want to look something up on the internet ( also free). We got all this for a very good price! You could also pay 8 euro for breakfast but we did not do that since there is a million of nice an cosy cafes just outside the hotel. (i should also mention that we were not bothered by any noise or anything from the streets) I would definitely stay here again! also recommend it for others!

Reviews.Title: “Good deal if part of a package”
Reviews.Author: georgetacik
Reviews.Content: Like the previous reviewer, I stayed at this hotel as part of $1,000-per-person 9-day Sunwing Vacations Package from Toronto and was satisfied with it. Yes, my room was small but it was comfortable. I happened to be in Paris during a summer cold spell, so I did not need air conditioning and kept the window closed at night. Didn't hear any noise and had no trouble sleeping. It's in a small L-shaped lane that's mostly used for parking, so this is as quiet as a street gets in downtown Paris. The north end of the lane comes out into BergÃ¨re Street and the west end into Faubourg Montmartre Street. It's a good deal if it's part of a package, but no bargain if you book it separately. It costs about 100 euros ($140) for a room and 10 euros ($14) for the continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice crash pad in a great location”
Reviews.Author: christos_81
Reviews.Content: Hotel Despagne Spent 4 nights here from June 29-July 4 part of a 5 day Sunwing Vacation package out of Toronto. This was our 3rd time in Paris. Previous 2 times I could say that those hotels were small. This hotel was even smaller, especially the shower/bathroom ! Hardly any room to move around. The hotel is located in a courtyard off the street with about 5 or 6 other hotels surrounding it. The main corner, there is a shoe store on one side and a crepe wondow on the other. The entrance ( walkway to the courtyard) has the name of another hotel on the top. Right across the street is Restaurant Cartier. There is a bar right in front of the hotel, but it closed pretty early so the noise that kept us up at night was drunk people who would walk through the alley and either be arguing with someone or just screaming for no reason. We had to keep the window open because there was no air conditioning in the room. So its either be woken up to sleep with a breeze or have no noise whatsoever but be very warm. The TV in the room has only 1 english channel but we didnâ€™t care because as soon as we got up we went out for the day and we were so tired when we got back that we went straight to bed. The room was clean however and daily maid service was good. There was also breakfast in the morning. Donâ€™t think north American bacon and eggs but traditional French breakfast of baguette, some butter, piece of cheese, yogurt, juices milk and coffee. Very nice snack and refueling before the day to start. One more bonus of the hotel is that it has free wireless. When using your device, it will ask for username and password. Just ask the front desk that you want to use wireless and they will print out a receipt with a username and password to use good for 24 hours, so every day just ask for a new one. So that is the hotel. I would give it 3 out of 5. no real complaints, we expected it and it was our 3rd time here so didnâ€™t have high expectations, but if this was my first time visiting or coming for a special occasion I would definitely shell out some more money to stay somewhere bigger etc.. if your not picky and just need a place to crash, its perfect. The area itself is convenient. 2 minute walk to the Metro Grand Boulevards which is on Line 8 â€“ Purple. This line goes to the major attractions like invalids, ecole militaire ( Eiffel) etc.. but it also connects to other lines which you would use to visit the main sites. The surrounding area itself is pretty lively as well. When you get out on the main street and you head left ( i./e towards Bonelle station), take one of the main streets here down to St.Eustache. the area around that church is full of little bars and pubs it was so nice. Or you could simply take a 10-15 minute walk to the Opera or 2 metro stops. We walked with our luggage from the Roissy bus stop outside opera to the hotel and it wasnâ€™t a problem since it was big sidewalks. We took the metro back to roissy stop when leaving only because we had no time but it was rush hour and it was a disaster trying to get on with luggage so we should have just walked it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Affordable Option in Paris”
Reviews.Author: GigHarmon
Reviews.Content: We decided to extend our trip to Paris by one day and found a really great rate for this hotel online. It provided everything we needed: A clean room, private bathroom, comfortable bed, convenient location, friendly and helpful staff, and affordable price. Despite being small, the room still had plenty of space to store luggage, shelves and hangers for clothes, and a desk. We were there on a very hot day and were nervous it might be uncomfortable without a ceiling fan. But luckily it cooled down at night and we enjoyed a nice breeze with the windows open. The hotel is located down a quaint back alleyway with a bunch of other hotels, and is about a two minute walk to the Grands Boulevards Metro Station (most of the major sites can be easily and quickly reached). They offer breakfast but we left too early to check it out. Given how expensive hotels are in Paris, and how little time we planned to actually stay in our room, I feel lucky to have found this great option at such a discounted price!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it here”
Reviews.Author: Joy056
Reviews.Content: I was travelling with my daughter & daughter in law. the hotel was in an excellent area, cafes, shops & handy to the underground. The lift broke down one day & we had to use the stairs but that was soon fixed. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room & bathroom was small but adequate for the price and the beds were comfy. There was a cafe in the street below but there was no noise from there at all. I slept very well. I would definiftely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: brainless69
Reviews.Content: went to paris for the night on the 4th march, was looking to stay in a hostel orginally but realised it would have ended up costing us both more than what i paid for this lovely hotel. The hotel is situated in an amazing location!! Its about a 25minute walk from gare du nord station, 10 minutes from the louvre. its like a litte city of hotels in the same area off the main shopping boulevard. The room had two single beds LCD tv shower and bathroom. I guess if your not fussy and want a suite the room is perfect for a short break. There are plenty of restaurants/shops/bars within a few minutes walk from the hotel so you dont have to worry about being hungry thirsty or anything. I would definatly recommend this hotel if your looking for somewhere central to stay at a VERY affordable price

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for Paris”
Reviews.Author: pdnrn Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is tucked away in a mews off the Grands Boulevards with excellent connections through the metro. Quite a lively area without being too loud or aggressive. Standard reception with a very friendly helpful staff who are competent in english if you need it. In typical Paris fashion and one of two downsides, the room was very small with just enough room to move around the bed. The window also looked out on to a shaft with very little natural light. The en-suite was spacious with shampoos etc and everything worked. The room looked newly decorated and was spotless. This was one of the better hotels I have stayed in inParis at tis price range and I would use it again as long as I could get a room with an outward facing window.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very small rooms, noisy very early......”
Reviews.Author: mlindop
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean and in a great location, however the room was tiny, as was the shower room and the bed was barely a double. None of this would have mattered very much, but being woken at 6.30 to hear everyones morning ablutions and movements made it impossible to sleep. Breakfast was adequate. WiFi was very good

Reviews.Title: “Decent budget choice in great location”
Reviews.Author: Onofrius
Reviews.Content: As mentioned in other reviews, it's a terrific location, in a quiet alley behind Grands Boulevards. It's a well-presented hotel, with very frinedly and polite staff, and the room was clean. It was, however, the smallest room that I have ever had, and really shouldn't be a double. The manager, before giving us the key, informed us of this, and so offered us complimentay breakfast, which was very decent of him. Nevertheless, there was no space to put bags - and certainly we could not have had a suitcase in there. Quite simply, it ought to be a single room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location between the centreand gare du nord”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Princessa
Reviews.Content: Located in a small hidden street, this little hotel was a nice suprise. i was given a large room on the ground floor with a even larger bathroom. the room was clean and very comfortable although basic it was comfortable enough for a few nights. the location was nice and a mins walk took you to the main street with restaurants and shops, 15-20 mins walk took you tot he river seine and the louvre. This was a for me a perfect location and lovely hotel with a very friendly owner who you can see is trying to make your trip a memorable one he is happy to help you any way he can. The other staff were intelligent and attentive and didnt leave you waiting intheline for more than a few mins. Very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, nice staff, but deceptively noisy back street"”
Reviews.Author: FrankPeer
Reviews.Content: First impression at check in ( at around 21H00) was a bit cold, the young guy at reception was not particularly friendly, avoiding eye contact and waiting for us to say "Hello" first. All the other staff were very friendly during our 3 days there, including the Italian born (I believe)manager, the maid and the breakfast lady, who generously offered more croissants when I asked for more butter one morning. Breakfast is served from 7 to 10, which is good. Room 307 was smallish, especially with a far too big unnecessary armchair next to the twin beds. Shower was small but hot and clean. Small TV on the wall. Wifi available in your room but you need to request a password from reception. On this side of the hotel there is a "Singing Bistro" right under the rooms, on the opposite side of the street, with tables outside when it's warm enough. People were very noisy until 3 in the morning on a Sunday night, so if you want to keep your window slightly open as we did (very stuffy and only a fan-tower is provided), make sure you have earplugs, as you will share the Bistro's happy mood more than you might wish to! Even when the bistro was closed, street was still noisy with people's chatter or very early rubbish collection. After checking out (at 1200) we were able to leave our bags in a dedicated room in the lobby (staff give you a bag tag with a unique number), which was very useful as our flight didn't leave until late that evening. Location is great, right near the GrÃ©vin Museum, the tube station, a 10 minute walk to the Opera or 15 to the Forum des Halles.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little hotel in centre of Paris”
Reviews.Author: madison5
Reviews.Content: Ok, so I had mixed feelings about this hotel after reading the other reviews, but I could not fault it or the staff from the moment I entered to the hotel to the moment we left. Small hotel down a quiet alley of hotels. 5 minute walk to the nearest metro that serves two mainline routes making it very easy to get to all the main attractions of Paris. 20/30 minute walk to la Louve. Resturants and shops all very close to the hotel. Staff were very plesant and helpfull throughout the visit - all can speak English. The room was a suitable size for 2 people (we were top floor - whether that would make a difference I dont know) bed was harder than i'm used to but that's just me - I still sleep well, no noise. Rooms cleaned everyday with clean towels and soaps provided. Bathroom a OK size (and i'm pretty tall/large) The breakfast was good for the price (included in the package) otherwise you pay 8euros per peson. It's not worth 8euros but if your on B&B its worth it. The only thing about this hotel was the smell of the drains in the bathroom. Not the hotels fault, this is a problem in Paris/France so maybe take on air freshner with you! I would happily go back to this hotel. Very pleased indeed.

Reviews.Title: “not perfect, but great for the price”
Reviews.Author: mattabessett
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights in July. The location is really pretty good, in a quiet alley of hotels 1 block from a metro stop and a 25 minute walk to the Louvre. Lots of decent restaurants around as well as a small Carrefour grocery store. The hotel is a bit shabby in apearance, especially carpeting, dimly lit hallways, and the shower was very small. Another issue is that there was no A/C, and the one hot night we had was a bit uncomfortable (there was a good fan in the room, which helped). All that aside, this was a really good price for a hotel in Paris, and if you are looking for a budget stay, this will do fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good value!Good location!”
Reviews.Author: Lingaro
Reviews.Content: Good value hotel in a dood location for this price. Clean room, comfortable beds. Free Wifi in the room.Freindly staff.Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - easy walking to Louvre, Moulin Rouge, Tower”
Reviews.Author: Rescue1959
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel - basic but very comfortable. Friendly and helpful staff. Great breakfasts!! Easy 20 min walk to the Louvre, 30min to Montmartre and the Moulin Rouge. About an hour easy walking along the river to Eiffel Tower, or through the Louvre Park, along the Champs Elysees to the Arc de Triomphe. Couple of little grocery shops within a 100yds, much cheaper to buy beer, wine and food here than pay exorbitant Paris prices!!! Great little bistro, Vert Midi, a couple of streets away, in the Rue Saint Marc. Very reasonable prices for great food - try the stuffed rabbit loin!!! We had a first floor room, over looking the street...great little jazz bar on the corner. Lots of bars and eateries around the immediate area. Metro just around the corner

Reviews.Title: “Lovely find - definately re-visit”
Reviews.Author: alison-keighley
Reviews.Content: Very clean, compact, good continental breakfas, staff very pleasant. Very near the Metro, you can walk from here to Opera to pick up the open top tourist bus. Taxi from the airport 50 euros, we were told to pick up taxi at the taxi rank rather than book from hotel or on line as this works out cheaper and certainly this was the case. I would definately come here again. There was some noise from the bar acrross the street on Saturday night but nothing unpleasant and certainly no traffic noise as the hotel is in a back street. Travelled with 3 women friends and we all felt safe in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Great find amongst a great city”
Reviews.Author: mn2ca2az
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through British Airways. I picked it based on reviews and location . It is about 2 blocks to the underground and about a 10 min walk to the Opera. The room was small but clean. We were on the 4th floor looking out onto the alley (with a bar below). With the window open the noise from the bar was a bit much. Be careful of the shower as the shower head faces out to the curtain. You could easily soak the bathroom. The continental breakfast was good and was a good start to our day. The front desk staff was very helpful and polite. I'd stay here again.....

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed twice and would stay again”
Reviews.Author: mas_kjg
Reviews.Content: If you are on a budget and need a place to stay during a short-term trip to Paris, we would recommend Emeraude Hotel D'Espagne. We have stayed here twice (3 nights each visit) and it meets our needs. It is incredibly close to the metro station, although the hotel itself is tucked away off a small side street so it pays to have a map handy! It is roughly a 15 minute walk from the Opera area too so location wise we found it perfect for getting around Paris. Don't be afraid of the metro system as it is very handy! Rooms are clean, small and no-frills and breakfast isn't anything exceptional but it was fine for what we paid for. There was a bit of noise coming through the street-side window at night, however. The service we have received has always been friendly and helpful, the staffs' English is understandable and they have been able to give us recommendations and advice. There are lots of eateries nearby which is helpful although the staff recommended a restaurant across the road, there was a big queue so we didn't go in. Overall, we would recommend Emeraude Hotel D'Espagne to anyone visiting Paris on a budget looking for somewhere clean and convenient to stay.

Reviews.Title: “good suprise for a 2 star!”
Reviews.Author: divinidylle
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and I really cannot complain. Clean, quiet area, pleasant management. It is close to MusÃ©e Tussauds and not too far from the Opera. The area is not the best in Paris (next to GRAND BOULEVARDS metro station and a lot of restaurants) but this is reflected in the price anyway. It is location in an inside streed with very low trafic and with many hotels (because of this, it could be difficult to find the first time, so use a map if first time in Paris as it is kind of an inside court/ and again not in a main street !!!), so this is already a good point as you will not be disturbed by any street noise. Just note that there is no airconditioning in the rooms, no fridge and no safe, so if this is important for you, i would stay somewhere else. Cannot talk about the breakfast as it was not included in my reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet hotel near Metro. Good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: JJrich09
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights on first wonderful visit to Paris. Room was small but clean with good ensuite. Lots of good cafes and shops near by and very close to Metro. Down an alley way with several other Hotels. Had double glazing so very quiet if windows shut. Breakfast included in the price and was adequate. Staff were friendly and helpful with recommendations for restaurants etc.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE, GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: carolgyrl
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. We asked many questions. It is a typical small hotel. ( No room service!)They are in a good area, with the metro close by. We did not try the breakfast, as there as so many places around the hotel to eat. The internet service they do offer is timed in a 30 minute block for 5 euros at a time.We would stay there again, and would recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest small hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: TouristRome
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our two teenaged sons over Easter and had a fabulous time. Particularly outstanding is the service offered by the manager who was helpful to the extreme. For my next trip to Paris I will definitely come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money, central, v. friendly staff - a definite hit!”
Reviews.Author: JudiMadrid
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel for 2 nights with 2 friends. We had a double room (75 euos the night) and a single room (65). The location couldn't have been better. It's very central with a metro station just round the corner and only a 5 minute stroll to Opera, surrounded by lots of bistros and cafes for that morning coffee and croissant! Having said that, as it's in a quiet pedestrianised street it was not noisy at all and we managed to get 2 great night sleeps. The staff were lovely and guided us with chea ways of seeing the city and where to go...etc. If i ever go back to Paris, I will definitely come to this hotel. You really can't beat it for location, value for money and friendliness.

Reviews.Title: “Best price for this qualitiy in this neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: tristan118
Reviews.Content: I am often going in this part of Paris for business issues. More or less 3 stars are quite similar. This one is cheaper than the others for same services and equivallent room. Staff is above average and price is below. Best choice obviously around the Rue Bergere where you can find quite a lot hotels...

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: OscarTheTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at this hotel after some long days sightseeing and found it clean and comfortable. Good location to the tourist spots.

HotelInfo.Name: Emeraude Hotel D'Espagne
HotelInfo.Address: 9 Cite Bergere | 09 Arr., 75009 Paris, France
